revision.comment: /* Fair use candidate from Commons: File:US Navy 110928-N-IC287-001 The littoral combat ship Pre-Commissioning Unit (PCU) Fort Worth (LCS 3) is underway in Green Bay, Wis. Fort Worth.jpg */
revision.text:
{{WikiProject Ships|class=B|B1=y|B2=y|B3=y|B4=y|B5=y|importance=low}} {{WPMILHIST|class=B|B1=y|B2=y|B3=y|B4=y|B5=y|Maritime=y|US=y}} == How can the ships be the same length? == http://opencrs.com/document/RL33741/2010-10-14/?25482 :For LCS 3, the contractor has incorporated a design change to extend the transom by four meters to improve stability. Why then is USS Cowtown the same length as Freedom? [[User:Hcobb|Hcobb]] ([[User talk:Hcobb|talk]]) 14:09, 25 October 2010 (UTC) ==File:US Navy 110928-N-IC287-001 The littoral combat ship Pre-Commissioning Unit (PCU) Fort Worth (LCS 3) is underway in Green Bay, Wis. Fort Worth.jpg Nominated for speedy Deletion== {| |- | [[File:Image-x-generic.svg|100px]] | An image used in this article, [[commons:File:US Navy 110928-N-IC287-001 The littoral combat ship Pre-Commissioning Unit (PCU) Fort Worth (LCS 3) is underway in Green Bay, Wis. Fort Worth.jpg|File:US Navy 110928-N-IC287-001 The littoral combat ship Pre-Commissioning Unit (PCU) Fort Worth (LCS 3) is underway in Green Bay, Wis. Fort Worth.jpg]], has been nominated for speedy deletion at [[Wikimedia Commons]] for the following reason: ''Other speedy deletions'' ;What should I do? ''Don't panic''; deletions can take a little longer at Commons than they do on Wikipedia. This gives you an opportunity to contest the deletion (although please review Commons guidelines before doing so). The best way to contest this form of deletion is by posting on the image talk page. * If the image is [[WP:NFCC|non-free]] then you may need to upload it to Wikipedia (Commons does not allow fair use) * If the image isn't freely licensed and there is no [[WP:FUR|fair use rationale]] then it cannot be uploaded or used. * If the image has already been deleted you may want to try [[commons:COM:UR|Commons Undeletion Request]] To take part in any discussion, or to review a more detailed deletion rationale please visit the relevant [[commons:File:US Navy 110928-N-IC287-001 The littoral combat ship Pre-Commissioning Unit (PCU) Fort Worth (LCS 3) is underway in Green Bay, Wis. Fort Worth.jpg|image page (File:US Navy 110928-N-IC287-001 The littoral combat ship Pre-Commissioning Unit (PCU) Fort Worth (LCS 3) is underway in Green Bay, Wis. Fort Worth.jpg)]] ''This is Bot placed notification, another user has nominated/tagged the image'' --[[User:CommonsNotificationBot|CommonsNotificationBot]] ([[User talk:CommonsNotificationBot|talk]]) 20:48, 23 February 2012 (UTC) |} == Camouflage notable? == http://www.navy.mil/submit/display.asp?story_id=75109 Notable yet? [[User:Hcobb|Hcobb]] ([[User talk:Hcobb|talk]]) 00:39, 30 June 2013 (UTC) == Fair use candidate from Commons: [[:File:US Navy 110928-N-IC287-001 The littoral combat ship Pre-Commissioning Unit (PCU) Fort Worth (LCS 3) is underway in Green Bay, Wis. Fort Worth.jpg]] == The file [[:File:US Navy 110928-N-IC287-001 The littoral combat ship Pre-Commissioning Unit (PCU) Fort Worth (LCS 3) is underway in Green Bay, Wis. Fort Worth.jpg]], used on this page, has been [[:commons:File:US Navy 110928-N-IC287-001 The littoral combat ship Pre-Commissioning Unit (PCU) Fort Worth (LCS 3) is underway in Green Bay, Wis. Fort Worth.jpg|deleted from Wikimedia Commons]] and re-uploaded at [[:File:US Navy 110928-N-IC287-001 The littoral combat ship Pre-Commissioning Unit (PCU) Fort Worth (LCS 3) is underway in Green Bay, Wis. Fort Worth.jpg]]. It should be reviewed to determine if it is compliant with this project's non-free content policy, or else should be deleted and removed from this page. [[User:Commons fair use upload bot|Commons fair use upload bot]] ([[User talk:Commons fair use upload bot|talk]]) 04:47, 2 March 2012 (UTC) : Hang on here, aren't all unclassified US Govt images in the public domain? (Yes I realize I'm asking a dumb bot. Maybe a smart entity will answer.) [[User:Dmforcier|Dmforcier]] ([[User talk:Dmforcier|talk]]) 23:46, 29 May 2016 (UTC) ::Smart (alec) entity: That was 4 years ago. It's long gone. :) - [[User:BilCat|BilCat]] ([[User talk:BilCat|talk]]) 23:59, 29 May 2016 (UTC) ::: I realize that. I was asking the question for future reference. [[User:Dmforcier|Dmforcier]] ([[User talk:Dmforcier|talk]]) ::::The "Hang on there" implied an urgency to stop the deletion, so it wasn't apparent you knew how old the post was. And yes, uncategorized US Government images are in the public domain, provided there's proof of their origin as such. Manufacturers often publish copyrighted images that are posted on Government websites, usually with a copyright or "courtesy of" notice, so we do have to be careful to make sure an image is correctly documented. That seems to have been the issue here. - [[User:BilCat|BilCat]] ([[User talk:BilCat|talk]]) 01:47, 30 May 2016 (UTC) ::::: Ah, okay. Thanks. [[User:Dmforcier|Dmforcier]] ([[User talk:Dmforcier|talk]]) == Reclassification == According to [[Proceedings (magazine)|Proceedings]], the Navy Dept has decided to reclassify LCS as frigate (FF). (If we ever produce a mine countermeasures version that will likely be reclassified as MCM). So when will this occur and how will the various LCS articles be handled?
[[User:Dmforcier|Dmforcier]] ([[User talk:Dmforcier|talk]]) 18:13, 23 September 2015 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just added archive links to {{plural:2|one external link|2 external links}} on [[USS Fort Worth (LCS-3)]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=701910976 my edit]. If necessary, add {{tlx|cbignore}} after the link to keep me from modifying it. Alternatively, you can add {{tlx|nobots|deny{{=}}InternetArchiveBot}} to keep me off the page altogether. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20070808165514/http://peoships.crane.navy.mil/lcs/factsheet.htm to http://peoships.crane.navy.mil/lcs/factsheet.htm *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20121023140337/http://www.star-telegram.com/2012/09/22/4280079/uss-fort-worth-commissioned-in.html to http://www.star-telegram.com/2012/09/22/4280079/uss-fort-worth-commissioned-in.html When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' to let others know. {{sourcecheck|checked=true}} Cheers.â€”[[User:Cyberbot II|cyberbot II]][[User talk:Cyberbot II|Talk to my owner]]:Online 09:01, 27 January 2016 (UTC)
